description: Temporary change of use of the site from Class C2 (residential institutions) to Class F.2 (c) (Areas or places for outdoor sport or recreation) - Padel Sports Centre. Installation of 3 padel courts within pavilion enclosure and 1 external padel court, canopies, 2x cabins, car parking and cycle storage, associated landscaping, boundary treatment and erection of floodlights.
decision_conditions: Occupier
The development must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date hereof.Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990, as amended.

All on site activities must operate as detailed in the submitted Noise Addendum Note referenced 21024/AN/001 prepared by ES Acoustics Ltd and dated 15 May 2025.Reason: To safeguard the amenity of the neighbours in accordance with Policy 29 of the Sutton Local Plan 2018 by minimising impacts of the development that would otherwise give rise to nuisance.

The temporary Padel Sports Centre hereby approved shall only operate between the hours of 08.00 and 22.00, 7 days a week, and at no other times.Reason: To safeguard the amenity of the neighbours in accordance with Policy 29 of the Sutton Local Plan 2018 by minimising impacts of the development that would otherwise give rise to nuisance.

Any works during the demolition / construction phase that generates noise beyond the site boundary shall be only carried out between the hours of 08.00 and 18.00 Mondays to Fridays and between 08.00 and 13.00 on Saturdays and not at all on Bank Holidays and Sundays.Reason: To safeguard the amenity of surrounding occupiers during the construction phase in accordance with Policies 29 and 34 of Sutton Local Plan 2018.

The development must be carried out in accordance with the provisions of the Fire Safety Statement prepared by JMS Planning & Development Ltd.Reason: To ensure that the development incorporates the necessary fire safety measures in accordance with the Mayor's London Plan Policy D12.

All tree(s) on and adjacent to the site shown to be retained shall be protected in accordance with the Arboricultural information submitted with the Application (Arboricultural Method Statement and Tree Protection Plan) and follow recommendations in British Standard BS 5837: Trees in Relation to Design, Demolition and Construction - Recommendations (2012). There will be no materials stored within the Construction Exclusion Zone (CEZ), and the Tree Protection Fencing (TPF) and other measures shall only be removed on completion of development. On completion of development, the applicant (their heirs or successors in title) shall submit photographic evidence of compliance with BS5837:2012. Reason: To ensure tree(s) significant in terms of their provision of local amenity are protected from construction damage, in accordance with best practice and Policy 28 of the Sutton Local Plan 2018.

The development must be carried out in accordance with the provisions set out in the submitted Local Resident and Worker Priority Promise and Social Impact Statement prepared by Social Sports Society and dated 2025, unless otherwise agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority. Reason: To ensure compliance with the allocation of the London Cancer Hub site in accordance with Policies 2 and 40 of the Sutton Local Plan 2018.

The development hereby approved shall be constructed in accordance with the following materials:The cabins would be steel containers in anthracite grey (RAL 7016),the pavilion of the courts would be in PVC anthracite grey (RAL 7016),treated timber fence posts and panels and treated timber decking walkways,entrances, fencing, signage, seating, and flooring with tones from yellow to green,The approved materials shall be used in the construction of the development hereby approved, completed prior to its occupation/use and retained thereafter for the temporary life of the development.Reason: To enable the Local Planning Authority to control the development in detail in the interests of visual amenity and in accordance with Policy 28 of Sutton Local Plan 2018.

The development must be constructed in accordance with the submitted Ecological Lighting Assessment prepared by Strenger dated March 2025, SK-01 Assessed Scheme of Lighting prepared by Strenger, SK-02 Light Spill prepared by Strenger and Lighting details (photometric polar plots). The development shall be carried out in full accordance with the approved details and thereafter retained for the duration of the temporary use.Reason: To protect the biodiversity value of the land and adjacent land in accordance with Policy 26 of the Sutton Local Plan 2018.

Within 3 months of the commencement of operation, a noise survey report shall be undertaken and submitted to the Local Planning Authority. The noise survey will identify the noise levels during operational hours of the Padel Sports Centre in relation to the surrounding residential properties. The timing and location of the survey shall be agreed with the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the survey. Should the survey results indicate noise levels above those agreed in the approved Noise Impact Assessment Report (prepared by ES Acoustics Ltd dated March 2025) and its Addendum (ref: 21024/AN/001 prepared by ES Acoustics Ltd and dated 15 May 2025), mitigation measures will be required and shall be fully implemented in accordance with the approved Noise report and retained for the duration of the temporary use.Reason: To protect neighbouring occupiers from unacceptable noise levels in accordance with Policy 29 of the Sutton Local Plan 2018.

The use of the application site for the purpose of a Padel Sports Centre falling within Class F.2 (c) (Areas or places for outdoor sport or recreation) of the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 (as amended) shall be for a 7-year temporary period beginning with the date hereof. At the end of the temporary period the development hereby approved shall be removed and the state of the land shall revert to a scheme submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Reason: To enable the Local Planning Authority to not prejudice the future redevelopment of the allocated 'London Cancer Hub' and to review the impact on neighbouring amenity and highways of the temporary use through the passage of the time in accordance with Polices 2, 29, 37 and 40 of the Sutton Local Plan 2018.

The development hereby permitted, shall only be occupied by a Padel Tennis Club falling within Class F.2 (c) (Areas or places for outdoor sport or recreation) as defined by the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 (as amended), notwithstanding the changes to the Use Classes Order in relation to Use Class F. No other 'F' use class is permitted without seeking full or temporary planning permission.Reason: To enable the Local Planning Authority to assess all the implications of the development on highway safety, parking and neighbouring amenities in accordance with Policies 29, 36 and 37 of Sutton Local Plan 2018.

Prior to commencement of the development hereby approved, a badger survey and precautionary working methods for reptiles and hedgehogs must be carried out in accordance with the submitted Preliminary Ecological Report prepared by Arbtech Consulting Ltd and dated March 2025. Any  mitigation strategy required resulting from the the badger survey must be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement. The approved strategy shall be implemented on site prior to the first occupation of the development hereby approved.Reason: To protect the biodiversity value of the land in accordance with Policy 26 of the Sutton Local Plan 2018. Reason for pre-commencement: This condition is required to be pre-commencement to ensure that the biodiversity value of the land is fully assessed and is not harmed and / or fully mitigated for, prior to the construction and operation process.

No above ground development shall take place, until the outcome of infiltration testing to BRE Digest 365 has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority to demonstrate that infiltration SuDS measures such as the proposed soakaway are feasible at this location.Reason: To comply with Policy 31 of the Sutton Local Plan 2018.

The development hereby approved shall be constructed in accordance with the approved Flood Risk Assessment and Drainage Strategy prepared by Ridge and Partners Ltd (PO1) and dated March 2025. Prior to first occupation/use of the development, written confirmation that the approved SuDS measures have been implemented as part of the development as built must be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. All of the approved measures must thereafter be retained for as long as the development is in existence.Reason: To comply with Policy 31 of the Sutton Local Plan 2018.

Prior to first use of the development hereby permitted, full details of refuse and recycling storage shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The approved details shall be implemented in full prior to first use of the development and retained thereafter for the temporary life of the development. Reason: To avoid harm to the character and appearance of the streetscene and local area in accordance with Policy 28 of the Sutton Local Plan 2018, to ensure the operational requirements of the site can be met and to ensure adequate provision of refuse and recycling facilities in accordance with Policy 29 of the Sutton Local Plan 2018.

The development shall not be used until space has been laid out within the site in accordance with the approved plans for 16 cars, including 2 accessible car parking spaces. The car parking area shall be used and retained exclusively for its designated purpose for the temporary life of the development. Reason: To prevent obstruction and inconvenience to other highway users, in the interest of highway safety, and in accordance with Policies 36 and 37 of the Sutton Local Plan 2018.

Prior to first use of the development hereby permitted, full details of the 6 cycle spaces shall be submitted to, and approved in writing by, the Local Planning Authority which shall also show the position, size and materials of the provision and the means of access. The approved details and numbers of cycle spaces shall be implemented on site prior to the first occupation of the development hereby approved and retained for its designated purpose for the temporary life of the development.Reason: To ensure the development provides an adequate level of cycle parking facilities and to encourage sustainable modes of transport, in accordance with Policies 36 and 37 of the Sutton Local Plan 2018.

Prior to the use of the open-air padel court hereby approved plans and elevations detailing the method of enclosure of the proposed open air padel court shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Work shall be undertaken in accordance with the approved scheme and thereafter retained.Reason: To protect neighbour amenity in accordance with the aims of Policy 29 of the Sutton Local Plan 2018.

The development must be constructed in accordance with the submitted Outline Construction Logistics Plan (CLP) prepared by Pulsar Transport Planning and dated March 2025. The approved CLP shall be adhered to throughout the construction period.Reason: To ensure that the proposed development does not interfere with the free flow of traffic and conditions of safety on the public highway and does not have a significant adverse impact on the amenities of nearby residential properties in accordance with Policies 29, 34 and 36 of the Sutton Local Plan 2018.
